extension.dc:title: Germplasm accession (v20120911)
extension.dc:description: The Darwin Core extension for genebanks (DwC-germplasm) was developed in 2009 for sharing genebank datasets with the GBIF Integrated Publishing Toolkit from the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF). The GBIF IPT use the Darwin Core as the data standard in the core of a star schema with the germplasm extension and other extensions adding data properties from other standards. The DwC germaplasm provides some of the fundamental terms from the plant genetic resouces community for food and agriculture (PGRFA). Most of these terms are imported from the Multi-Crop Passport Descriptor List (MCPD) maintained by Bioversity International and the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO). Some few additional terms were developed by the European Coopertive Programme for Plant Genetic Resources (ECPGR). See also: http://code.google.com/p/darwincore-germplasm/
extension.name: GermplasmAccession

property.name: germplasmID
property.dc:description: A persistent identifier for a germplasm accession maintained as part of an ex situ genebank collection. Best practice is to use a globally unique and persistent identifier (PID).
property.examples: URI, DOI, LSID or similar; http://data.gbif.org/occurrences/215969415/

property.name: germplasmIdentifier
property.dc:description: Accession name. Either a registered or other formal designation given to the accession.
property.examples: Rheinische Vorgebirgstrauben; Emma; Avlon

property.name: biologicalStatus
property.dc:description: The biological status for a germplasm accession describes the cultivation status and distinguish wild and primitive cultivars from modern cultivars and breeding lines (material under development).
property.examples: Wild; Crop wild relative (CWR); Primitive; Traditional cultivar; Landrace; Breeding line; Genetic stock; Modern cultivar; 100; 110; 120; 200; 300; 400; 410; 411; 412; 413; 414; 415; 420; 500; 999

property.name: storageCondition
property.dc:description: Type of germplasm storage conditions.
property.examples: 10; 11; 12; 13; 20; 30; 40; 99, refer to FAO/IPGRI Genebank Standards 1994 for details on storage type.

property.name: collectingInstituteID
property.dc:description: Collecting institute ID.
property.examples: SWE054; urn:lsid:biocol.org:col:35293, an established institute code for the collecting/gathering institute.

property.name: lat
property.dc:description: Latitude of the collecting site for the source germplasm material.

property.name: lon
property.dc:description: Longitude of the collecting site for the source germplasm material.

property.name: alt
property.dc:description: Altitude of the collecting site for the source germplasm material.

property.name: breedingID
property.dc:description: Persistent identifier for the source germplasm developed by a plant breeder.
property.examples: Persistent identifier (PID) such as a URI, DOI, LSID or similar.

property.name: breedingIdentifier
property.dc:description: The germplasm name or accession number used by the plant breeder.
property.examples: Could be the breeders catalog number, or the name under which a cultivar was marketed.

property.name: breedingYear
property.dc:description: The year a germplasm accession was developed by a plant breeder. Could be the year the cultivar was released.

property.name: breedingCountry
property.dc:description: Name of the country in which the breeding event was conducted.
property.examples: Denmark; Finland; Iceland; Norway; Sweden

property.name: breedingCountryCode
property.dc:description: Code for the country in which the breeding event was conducted.
property.examples: DNK; FIN; ISL; NOR; SWE

property.name: breedingInstituteID
property.dc:description: Breeding institute code.
property.examples: SWE006; urn:lsid:biocol.org:col:35293

property.name: breedingInstitute
property.dc:description: Breeder institute name. If the FAO WIEWS institute code is available, this term is not to be reported.
property.examples: SvalÃ¶f Weibull AB Cereal Breeding Department

property.name: breedingPerson
property.dc:description: Name of the plant breeder.
property.examples: Gregor Mendel; Luther Burbank; Nils Herman Nilsson-Ehle

property.name: ancestralData
property.dc:description: Ancestral data, ANCEST. Information about either pedigree or other description of ancestral information.
property.examples: A pedigree, Hanna/7*Atlas//Turk/8*Atlas; or a description, mutation found in Hanna; selection from Irene.

property.name: purdyPedigree
property.dc:description: Ancestral information following the purdy pedigree format.

property.name: breedingRemarks
property.dc:description: Remarks to the breeding event.
property.examples: Supplementary comments and remarks related to the breeding event

property.name: acquisitionID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the event when germplasm material was acquired and included in the genebank collection.
property.examples: URI, DOI, LSID or similar

property.name: donorsID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the source germplasm material that was included in your genebank collection.
property.examples: http://data.gbif.org/occurrences/164390781/; URI, DOI, LSID or similar

property.name: donorsIdentifier
property.dc:description: An identifier for the source accession donated to your genebank collection. Could be an unique and stable local identifier specific to the dataset.

property.name: donorInstituteID
property.dc:description: Donor institute code.
property.examples: DEU146; NLD037; SWE054; urn:lsid:biocol.org:col:35293

property.name: donorInstitute
property.dc:description: Donor institute name. If the FAO WIEWS institute code is available, this term is not to be reported.
property.examples: Nordic Genetic Resources Center (NordGen)

property.name: acquisitionDate
property.dc:description: Acquisition date, date when the germplasm material (accession) entered the genebank collection.

property.name: acquisitionSource
property.dc:description: Collecting/acquisition source.

property.name: acquisitionRemarks
property.dc:description: Remarks to the acquisition event.
property.examples: General remarks related to the acquisition of the germplasm accession.

property.name: safetyDuplicationID
property.dc:description: A persistent identifier for the genebank accession in safe duplication storage.
property.examples: URI, DOI, LSID or similar

property.name: safetyDuplicationDate
property.dc:description: Date of safety duplication.

property.name: safetyDuplicationInstituteID
property.dc:description: Location of safety duplicates. Persistent identifier for the institute where a safety duplicate of the accession is maintained.
property.examples: NOR051; urn:lsid:biocol.org:col:35294

property.name: safetyDuplicationInstitute
property.dc:description: Location or institute for storage of safety duplicates.
property.examples: The name of the safety duplication institute

property.name: safetyDuplicationRemarks
property.dc:description: Remarks to the safety duplication event.
property.examples: General remarks related to the safety duplication of the germplasm material.

property.name: treatyOrRegulationID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the germplasm regulation or treaty.
property.examples: URI, DOI, LSID or similar

property.name: treatyOrRegulationName
property.dc:description: Regulation or treaty name.
property.examples: The International Treaty for Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture (ITPGRFA)

property.name: treatyOrRegulationGoverningBody
property.dc:description: Governing body for the regulation or treaty.
property.examples: Use the WIEWS institute code when possible

property.name: mlsStatus
property.dc:description: The status of a germplasm accession with regards to the Multilateral System (MLS) of the International TReaty on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture.
property.examples: No; Yes; Other
